segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Special Logon, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events under special sign on (or log on) circumstances.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Special Logon, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events under special sign on (or log on) circumstances.

segment.source: Audit Special Logon determines whether the operating system generates audit events under special sign on (or log on) circumstances.
segment.target: Audit Special Logon determines whether the operating system generates audit events under special sign on (or log on) circumstances.

segment.source: This subcategory allows you to audit events generated by special logons such as the following:
segment.target: This subcategory allows you to audit events generated by special logons such as the following:

segment.source: The use of a special logon, which is a logon that has administrator-equivalent privileges and can be used to elevate a process to a higher level.
segment.target: The use of a special logon, which is a logon that has administrator-equivalent privileges and can be used to elevate a process to a higher level.

segment.source: A logon by a member of a Special Group.
segment.target: A logon by a member of a Special Group.

segment.source: Special Groups enable you to audit events generated when a member of a certain group has logged on to your network.
segment.target: Special Groups enable you to audit events generated when a member of a certain group has logged on to your network.

segment.source: You can configure a list of group security identifiers (SIDs) in the registry.
segment.target: You can configure a list of group security identifiers (SIDs) in the registry.

segment.source: If any of those SIDs are added to a token during logon and the subcategory is enabled, an event is logged.
segment.target: If any of those SIDs are added to a token during logon and the subcategory is enabled, an event is logged.

segment.source: Medium on a domain controllers or network servers.
segment.target: Medium on a domain controllers or network servers.

segment.source: This subcategory is very important because of Special Groups related events, you must enable this subcategory for Success audit if you use this feature.
segment.target: This subcategory is very important because of Special Groups related events, you must enable this subcategory for Success audit if you use this feature.

segment.source: At the same time this subcategory allows you to track account logon sessions to which sensitive privileges were assigned.
segment.target: At the same time this subcategory allows you to track account logon sessions to which sensitive privileges were assigned.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: This subcategory is very important because of Special Groups related events, you must enable this subcategory for Success audit if you use this feature.
segment.target: This subcategory is very important because of Special Groups related events, you must enable this subcategory for Success audit if you use this feature.

segment.source: At the same time this subcategory allows you to track account logon sessions to which sensitive privileges were assigned.
segment.target: At the same time this subcategory allows you to track account logon sessions to which sensitive privileges were assigned.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: This subcategory is very important because of Special Groups related events, you must enable this subcategory for Success audit if you use this feature.
segment.target: This subcategory is very important because of Special Groups related events, you must enable this subcategory for Success audit if you use this feature.

segment.source: At the same time this subcategory allows you to track account logon sessions to which sensitive privileges were assigned.
segment.target: At the same time this subcategory allows you to track account logon sessions to which sensitive privileges were assigned.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: 4964(S): Special groups have been assigned to a new logon.
segment.target: 4964(S): Special groups have been assigned to a new logon.

segment.source: 4672(S): Special privileges assigned to new logon.
segment.target: 4672(S): Special privileges assigned to new logon.
